text.__SUMMARY__: Psathyrella gracilis, is the type species of the basidiomycete fungus genus Psathyrella and family Psathyrellaceae.  Originally described from France as "Agaricus gracilis", where its vernacular name is Psathyrelle gracile, the species is considered non-edible.
text.Nomenclature: The name given here is according to MycoBank, but according to Index Fungorum, the valid name should be Psathyrella corrugis (Pers.) Konrad & Maubl., 1949.
